runs.comm: slightly full, outside off and punched on the up over cover, in the air for a long time but beyond the ring, they pick up a couple - and Johnson has started with a no-ball, too. This could be an entertaining night
back of a length, really quick, up above 90mph and Lumb wafts unsuccessfully off the back foot
stays back in the crease and plays this to the bowler
length ball, slung down the leg side, Lumb misses though it's a wide anyway
back of a length, wide of the stumps and thick-edged over the slip, the ball skids away for England's first boundary
length, the ball swings markedly for Johnson, but beyond the tramlines - another wide, though Mitch isn't too happy about it
on the pads, uses the pace to flick it over square leg, the ball runs away for another boundary
full and in the slot and crunched through the covers, just leant on the drive and the ball raced away - just the start England needed in this chase
full and in the channel, punched on the font foot straight to cover
good length, outside off and squirts the ball behind square for a couple
good pace, stays back and misses with a dab
pitched up outside off, gets forward to drive and finds mid-off
heading down the leg side, attempts to flick the ball off his hip and it flicks the pad, goes through to the keeper
dug in slightly short, Hales seizes on it and scoops over square, didn't quite get hold of the pull
touch full and Lumb clears his front leg, clears the rope, England's first six of the night! That was all muscle, a Finch-esque mow down the ground
full, outside off, gets forward to punch a drive straight at mid-off
short of a length and wide, sits back and slaps a cut past backward point, powerful swing of the arms and the fielder was barely down before it was past him
tip and run towards mid-off, a direct hit from Faulkner would have run Hales out but with one stump to aim at he missed
slower ball, well directed yorker on Lumb's toes, he digs it out and Johnson fields

on the pads, Lumb flicks the ball high over midwicket like a man swinging his umbrella jauntily on the walk into the office, deep square does really well and to prevent four on the dive, wasn't a world away from catching it either
quick, on off stump, Lumb plays across the line and misses this time - that's lbw. Johnson gets a measure of revenge, sneaking the ball through Lumb, skidding on and would have clattered the timber

top-edged, the ball goes high towards square leg, there's almost a mix up between Matt Wade and the Fawad Ahmed but it's safely taken! Australia have two in two balls, Hales perishing in pursuit of <del>the impossible</del> quick runs
full and wide and battered through square, lovely timing on the drive and that's a good way to get off the mark

tries to dab the ball from the crease, did he get a tickle on that? Umpire Tim Robinson thinks so, though Wright is not happy at having to go. He was just trying to run one down to third man, maybe a faint sound as it went through
length, sliding down the leg side, Wade appeals for a catch ... but it's signalled wide
full and pushed back towards mid-on

short of a length, gets a top edge on the pull - crikey, that's lodged in the grill of Root's helmet! Root has taken this in the face, though he seems to be all right. The ball ended up stuck next to his right cheek, the grill made a sort of cartoon "dwoi-oi-oing" sound on the stump mic as the metal warped out of shape
overpitched and on the stumps, timed sweetly off the pads through midwicket, he's off the canvas and off the mark
lovely delivery, this is Morgan's first ball after the drama of that previous over, and he's beaten pushing at a shortish ball outside off
this is even better, angled in and holding its line, shaping past the edge

reaches for the drive, quite a wide delivery and he connects well but the ball sails straight to the man at cover point! Johnson is off and running in celebration, Maxwell didn't even have to move. England have got vertigo
back of a length and angled across from over the wicket, Bopara - get this - leaves
stays back and waits on a shortish ball, chops towards point but can't get it through
tucks up Bopara, short and over the top of the stumps, Bopara blocks it down on to the wicket
on the stumps, worked into the leg side
slower ball, Bopara frees the arms and drives, it squirts past the close fielder at extra cover
drags the ball down, maybe a tad slower again, Root neatly flicks the ball over midwicket for four - not going to be a Finch-like monstering from Root but he'll maul you gently, given the chance
fullish length, pushed back to mid-on
sliding down the leg side, Root closes the face and flicks a couple through backward square
opens the arms and pings a back-foot cut through point, beats the dive of the fielder and runs away for another boundary
looped out of the hand and drifting towards leg, swept very fine by Bopara, paddling down on it and that will run to the boundary
tossed up, on leg stump and swept again, towards deep backward square, Bopara wants two but won't get a second
length ball, Root reverses the hands and swats one through point
goes back to a legbreak outside off and steers a single behind square
sliding on to the pads, Root taps the ball into a gap on the leg side, they run well for a couple more
full and flighted around off stump, comes forward and punches one down the ground to long-off
on the stumps, stays deep in the crease and nudges a couple into the leg side
takes the pace of it, length ball wide of the stumps, Root dabs and mises
drops short, well directed but Root gets on top of a pull, rolls the wrists and places it well in front of deep sqaure leg for four more
flicks this one fine, on one leg and paddled round the corner, beats the fielder on the other side this time for another boundary
touch short, pulled fiercely on the front foot but straight to midwicket, there's a fumble though and they get one
good length, on the stumps, Bopara shows it a respectful defence
tossed up on off, Root comes forward and punches into the covers

full and on the stumps, reverses the hands and gets just a tickle on the ball to send it fine past the keeper, Ahmed was interested as it deflected away off the pad but Rob Bailey had spotted the bat involved beforehand
comes forward, full and pitching on leg, drops the ball into the leg side and they hustle for two
pulled forcefully through midwicket, bisects two men in the deep and although Marsh slid to stop it his back half had encroached over the rope
sliding towards leg stump, worked through square
tossed up, full and on the stumps, Bopara is down on one knee and swivels through a sweep
over the wicket, full and on leg stump, flicked fine for a couple as the fielder comes round
slower ball, sits up to be patted through square leg for one
attempted yorker from Faulkner and it disappears back past the bowler, Bopara standing up and smiting it on the full to long-on
shorter, angled across, opens the face and runs it to short third man
full and slightly wide, Root gets forward and tickles one into a gap in the covers
length ball, driven on the up down to long-off for another single
floated up wide of the off stump, drilled through the covers on the front foot, really well timed but cut off in the deep
sweeps across the line for a single through square
gets forward to a full ball on the stumps and taps one short on the off side

drifts down the leg side and Bopara misses with a sweep, Wade whips of the bails - it will be wide but the stumping has been referred. This is mighty fine, as Bopara lifted his back foot, which was safely back, just after Wade had broken the wicket. After a few looks, the third umpire Michael Gough decides the boot was fractionally still grounded
low full toss, clipped off the pads through square for a couple
floated up outside off and Bopara steps out of his ground to spank four through long-off, the ball bouncing past the fielder running round and striking an unfortunate cameraman
dropped short on the off side, Wade gives chase and misses, a direct hit would have done for Bopara
they chance another tight single, into the leg side, the attempt at the bowler's end is wide again
full and drifting on to the pads, Root flicks the ball fine to the man at long leg
Watson drops short, good connection from Bopara as he swings lustily across the line but picks out deep midwicket
short again, Root rolls his wrists on a pull but sends the ball to deep midwicket for another single
really well bowled from Watson, right up in the blockhole outside off, Bopara is beaten
full length, drive into the covers, well stopped to keep them to one
rolls the fingers, the ball sits up and Bopara pulls flat through midwicket, good running gets them a couple more
on the stumps, drags the ball through square for two
pulled hard and flat to mid-on, Bopara sends Root back and Warner misses with a throw that would have done for him

they do take on Warner's arm this time, only one stump to aim for but he hits, just a deflection at the base and Bopara is convinced he was out, so walks straight off. It was referred upstairs, though, and Gough decides that the bails were not out of the grooves when Bopara ran his bat in - it was mighty tight - and there's big cheer as he has to walk right out to the middle again from the dugout and continue his innings
slower ball, outside off, Root tries to reverse paddle the ball to third man, nearly tears his arms out of his sockets in failing to connect
down the leg side, that will be wide
slower ball, on the stumps, Root picks it and hoists the ball over midwicket, picks the gap between the two men out on the rope and gets four - that will be fifty for Root, in his first T20I knock
something like that! Stand-and-deliver six from Bopara, crunching a length ball from Watson over wide long-on, right out of the screws and it sails over the rope
swings lustily across the line, gets a couple towards deep midwicket
take cover! Watson nearly gets one in the throat as Bopara smashes a drive straight back at him, he jerks out of the way and the ball rockets to the rope
dug in short, Bopara pulls and splices to midwicket! This time he will be out! Bopara pulled merrily, come high off the bat and dropped into the mitts of the Warner, who gets his man
short, at the body, Buttler gets behind to defend
slower ball bouncer and he's been hit on the bonce this time, not quite as full-blooded as Root's though
gets forward, can't pierce the field at cover
googly this time, Root plays with the spin for a single through square leg
full and driven from under the eyeline into the covers, a misfield brings them one
drops way back in the crease, beaten by a big-turning legbreak and Wade breaks the bails again
done him in the flight, tossed up and gripping, Buttler slices a drive through backward point, didn't get hold of it but there's enough wood on it to send the ball to the rope
on the charge, digs the ball out towards mid-on for one
short of a length, pulls past the bowler for a single
bouncer, at the man, Root spots it and isn't going to be hit again, thwacks a pull between deep midwicket and wide long-on
short again, mistimed pull and a bottom edge runs short into the leg side
pitched up, Buttler chops down on it
steps away and plays a tennis shot down the ground, a swat of those Buttler forearms and six is served, straight over Hazlewood's head
pitched up, good yorker from Hazlewood, dug out into the off side
short and steered into the gully
sliced, hard and into a gap behind square, free flow of the arms and Root has used Johnson's pace to skim the ball flat and all the way over the rope
opens his body up again, backing away to crack a drive flat through the covers, that'll be four more
bouncer from Johnson, rolls the fingers over it but still comes out at around 80mph, Root pulls it flat through the air from outside off to deep square for another boundary!
sends it full and wide, Root misses but Johnson had overstepped again
good comeback, fast wide yorker and Root falls to connect again
Root moving about in his crease, trying to call Johnson's bluff, it's a low full toss outside off and prodded into the covers
full and sliding to leg, squirts the ball out through square
gets forward, hacks across the line and gets one down the ground to long-off

Root tries to get cute, goes across his stumps and tries to scoop, Faulkner had delivered the ball out of the back of the hand and the lack of pace foils him, it bounces over the stumps and through to Wade
comes forward, bunts a full ball into the ground to long-on for one
full and straight, squeezed off the pads to fine leg
this has been an excellent over from Faulkner, pitched up in the blockhole and clubbed to long-on for one more
excellent yorker from Watson, right up on Buttler's toes, he blocks it for one past the bowler

plays the reverse ramp, catches it on the full and flicks the ball low, straight to the man on the edge of the circle - but unfortunately that man is Fawad Ahmed, who completely misjudges it and the ball escapes his grasp like a bar of soap and runs for four
Root goes across, Watson drops short and slides down the leg side
short, proper bouncer, Root pulls into the air, takes his hand off the bat and it loops over square
tries to scoop another full ball, misses and is hit on the toe
sliding to leg, flicks across the line, good, firm connection and the ball slips to the boundary behind deep square leg
back away and drills a full ball through square, they come back for two
pitched up, wide of the stumps and clouted on the full through midwicket for a couple
length ball, Buttler steps away and smears the ball over wide long-off, don't think he caught that cleanly but it sailed over the rope
gone, leg stump out of the ground! Good follow up from Faulkner, full and fast and Buttler is castled  attempting to slog
no but he'll get four instead, standing up and levering the ball back over the bowler's head, mid-off is up and the ball races away
Broad swings and misses, they run anyway as Wade underarms past the stumps

dropped, off the last ball! Root swished across the line, got a thin inside edge but Wade grassed it, they scamper one more as the ball ran behind the keeper - but it's fairly academic, as Australia win by 39 runs
